Speaker: midget
Dialogue: Coffee?  It's nice and hot.

Speaker: midget
Dialogue: 15 Minutes to circus... 15 minutes to circus.

Speaker: ringmaster
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, we proudly present... "The Clowns"!

Speaker: mr schmidt
Dialogue: Not to mention how unprofessional that was...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: But it was an accident...

Speaker: gustav
Dialogue: Oh, sure it was... A very well planned and calculated accident!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I swear to you... it was an accident!

Speaker: gustav
Dialogue: I don't want to hear any more... You will get me another stooge. I don't want this man!!

Speaker: schmidt
Dialogue: Don't get excited, Gustav, you shall have it.

Speaker: gustav
Dialogue: You bet I will, or you shall have no show.

Speaker: schmidt
Dialogue: You will run with the other clowns and that's all you will do... is that clear?

Speaker: schmidt
Dialogue: And if there is another one of your cute tricks... I promise you will do your bits for the "Cats" while cleaning their cages!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Clause... give me a double whiskey with beer chaser.

Speaker: clause
Dialogue: You won't get "Funny" out of a bottle.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: And you won't make a dime sticking your nose in other people's business.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Helmut, darling, are you all right?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Do I look like I'm not all right?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: I was so worried about you...  Your dinner is cold and I couldn't imagine what happened to you...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Were you really worried about me or your stupid dinner was getting cold?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Sweetheart, I care about you...  I love you... I worry about you...  I can't help those feelings...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: If there is anything I don't need right now... it's your super- sentimentality...

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Helmut... what's tormenting your soul?  Please let me help you... talk to me...  I don't care what it is... I love you...  I'm your friend... you can trust me to understand...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I can't trust anybody... I don't know how to trust anybody...

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: I'm not anybody!  I'm your wife!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I'm sorry, my love... I'm so sorry... You're right!  You're not anybody. You're my wife and I love you, too... So very much I just have no one to fight back at... I'm lost and alone, I can't handle the disgrace of failure... the pain of being a has- been is more than I can bear...

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Schmidt again?  Gustav again?  When will you learn they fear you and they know how vulnerable you are now...  if they can beat you down then they needn't worry about you coming back to haunt them.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: They worry about me?  Don't be ridiculous...  they just took the last comic bit away from me... because of a silly accident...  I'm now down at the bottom, just a stooge assisting a not-so-funny clown.

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: But they can't take your talent away...  That's your strongest force!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: What the hell are you talking about? What talent?  And if I had any it's being suffocated into nothing... And that's just what I am now... nothing... No one... just empty... a prop to be used and mis-used... how does my great talent stand up to those odds?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: By not quitting... You must fight! Creative survival is even more difficult than human survival... You must fight!!!

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Go to Schmidt... Force a confrontation...  Don't let Gustav win...  make Schmidt see what an injustice they are imposing on you... Please, my love, fight!  Make your world better by fighting for it... You can do it... I know you can...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I will go now and see Schmidt... I will tell him I won't take any more degradation... I will tell him I am a "clown" not a stooge...  A "clown"... A special person...  A special clown...

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Go, my love... Go and fight for what you know is right... I will warm your dinner and wait for you to come home.

Speaker: schmidt
Dialogue: Naturally, I agree... Doork is a nuisance, but to just let him go seems a little unfair.

Speaker: gustav
Dialogue: Schmidt!  Don't make me put it on a "either him or me basis".

Speaker: schmidt
Dialogue: All right... all right... I'll give him --

Speaker: clause
Dialogue: It's your funeral.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: A funeral is usually in order when someone dies.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: The trouble with man today is that he takes everything for granted... he thinks things he's told to think... and accepts it! Just because we know meanings of words we use them and we fool ourselves...  people should use the dictionary more...  look up words like good... bad... honest... loyal... especially loyal,  I know what loyal means, and I have always been that... but does anyone care?  No!  Of course not...  Only when it is expedient... When it isn't ---  --- ZIPPPP!  You're out!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: And that goes for you too... Mine Fuhrer...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: ... you, too, are a fool.  You allow yourself to think you have "loyal" followers...  Ha!  Wait until they've had it with you...  You'll get yours... all the smiling, bowing, heel clicking idiots will shaft you too.  And you will deserve it because if you allow people like Herr Schmidt to got about his business of lying, and cheating, and being disloyal, one day all the Schmidts in Germany will turn on you and you will finish as the dumb little corporal you started as, and never know what hit you...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: He really has to be stupid --  I could help him by telling him about the people he thinks are good Germans... Ha!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: What are you staring at?  Didn't you ever see a man drink before?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: What's the matter?  Haven't you guys got a sense of humor?  You must have! Look how you're dressed!  Grown men in their little soldier suits... And the black coats and gloves... Like in a movie...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Real cloak and dagger stuff...  Didn't you Gestapo guys ever know that everybody can spot you a mile away?  Listen, if you really wanted to be unnoticed...  You should dress like plain people, then nobody would know you... You might even wear straw hats and shorts...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Straw hats and shorts!!  That's funny! Now that's really funny, isn't it? Straw hats and shorts!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Well, isn't that funny?   Think of it...  That's funny!   Why don't you laugh?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I know why you're not laughing... Because things you hear, you have to think about... I'll show you something that you'll laugh at because all you'll have to do is watch...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Ve vill conquer the world...  Heil me!  Heil me!  Heil me!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: STEINER !!!!  Get in here!

Speaker: corporal
Dialogue: Heil Hitler!  Reicher flips his wrist in answer to the heil, showing complete annoyance at having to do it.

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Do I see what I think I see here?

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Never put your hands on my desk... is that clear?

Speaker: corporal
Dialogue: Yes sir!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: MOVE IT!!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Now tell me, is this brief correct? Is that prisoner, the drunk, the one that impersonated the Fuehrer?

Speaker: corporal
Dialogue: Yes sir!  It is!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: I get all the weirdos...  Alright, Corporal, send him in!

Speaker: corporal
Dialogue: Yes sir!!!!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Alright, come in, sit down!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Are you Helmut Doork?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Doork, yes sir, Helmut Doork!  I am he!  Yes sir, that is correct, Doork!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: And are you a clown in the circus?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Not JUST A CLOWN!  I am Helmut Doork, Premier Clown!  I've clowned for the royal heads of many of our finest countries, why there were times when I had to...

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: That was years ago... According to these papers you are now just a helper in the circus with little or no importance!!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Some things are only temporary... Lt. Reicher!  Only yesterday, I had calls from one of the great circus owners in all of Europe... he...

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: You are NOTHING!!  You are a HAS BEEN!!  You WERE A CLOWN...

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: You are now a prisoner of the State and that's not funny... Can you make something funny out of that, Clown?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: No!  Lt. Reicher, I can't make anything funny from that thought...

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: It is no thought... It is fact, Clown, unquestionable fact!!  Now down to the issues at hand...  Did you willfully and with malice attack the State and impersonate the Fuhrer?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I was drunk!  It was a mistake!  I meant no disrespect... Sir... Honestly, I was drunk and not responsible for my actions and thoughts!  And my actions were subconscious!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Subconscious??  Meaning it was all motivated by truth that came out under the influence of alcohol!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I am a LOYAL German!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: And what kind of commendation would you expect for being a loyal German?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I want nothing!  But I'm more loyal than most Germans I know...

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Like who?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Ah, like... re...

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Names!   Names!!!  Who?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Sir!!!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I don't know, sir...

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: But you said other Germans... What OTHER Germans...  Who are they?  Why aren't they loyal?  Who?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I'm not responsible for what I say now...

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Why?  You're not drinking... you said you weren't responsible last night because you were drunk!  Are you drunk now?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: No, sir!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Then why are you not responsible now?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I don't know!!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: SIR!!!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I don't know -- sir !!!

Speaker: reicher
Dialogue: Why are you not responsible?  Why? Why?  Why?  Why?

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Excuse me, sir, but I wonder if you would help me... you see...

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: You don't understand...

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: HELMUT !

Speaker: ada
Dialogue: Go away !!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Tsk!  tsk!  tsk!  shame on you, Doork... shame...  don't you want to grow big and strong like me?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: We must eat our food!  Do we want Uncle to feed the little man?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: And now one for Aunt Ada...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Let go, Doork, let go... it's the soup that makes us big and strong... not the spoon... LET IT GO!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Now let's try it again...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: I said let's try it again...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Oh, I know why you're unhappy... soup without bread is terrible...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Isn't that better?  Now take some soup...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I've had enough, thank you... No more, please...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Please!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: I'm surprised at you, Doork, you've been here two years now, you should have learned we, of the Third Reich, never acknowledge the weak, sniveling, begging of you swine...  that's all you're good for... begging... pleading... praying...  you're a disgrace to the human race.  That's why we of the superior race must do away with all of you...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: And we will!  We will!  Do away with all of you.  You're worthless pigs... with no courage, no guts, why if anyone did to me what I just did to Doork I would kill him!  Why don't you kill me, Doork?  Go on...  kill me... kill me... take the knife from the table and kill me...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I would kill you... but I am getting my release any day now... and I won't do anything that would spoil my chances...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Your release?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Release?  They told me you were funny...  but I never realized just how funny you are...  RELEASE ????

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Dear God, please hear me!

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: He hears you, my son...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Here, here, easy, you can't do this to yourself...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: You frightened me, Johann, I'm sorry...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: You have nothing to be sorry for... Fear isn't something controlled by man...  fear can not be conferred with...  there isn't anyway known to mankind where man can say to himself...  "I will not be afraid"... Oh, certainly man can try to fight it... but faith and believing are man's only chance...  You must have faith... you must!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I have faith... but not always... sometimes it eludes me...  I can't remember to remember it.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: But that's natural... you can't expect to be perfect in what you try to do...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I don't know...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I heard what happened at breakfast this morning with ROTHMAN, the guard...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Will they do something to me? What have you heard?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Nothing, absolutely nothing... don't worry about it... I just wanted you to know that I believe you handled yourself admirably...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: That was one time I didn't care for the laughs I was getting from some of the men...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Of course you didn't... but I'm sure you know man laughs for two reasons... one because something is funny... two, because they fear showing fear... they laughed because "there but for the grace of God go I!"

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Do you really think so?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I'm certain of it!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Thank you, Johann.  I always feel so much better after you talk to me...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I'm glad, Helmut, I'm very glad... you know you can always talk to me, about anything...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Oh!  I almost forgot...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Before breakfast this morning,  I spoke to one of the guards, a very intelligent one, and he seems quite nice and friendly too.  Well, he said that the Gestapo has set up a special review board to handle cases just like mine.  And he said he would get me a form, a special form.  Just been printed up.  And I'm to fill it out.  Isn't that good?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: How many times since you've been here, have you filled out forms? Twenty?  Thirty times??

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: But this is different.  It's entirely new.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: See?  These are made up by the Gestapo itself... and the form will go directly to Berlin, to Gestapo headquarters.  That's the important thing about this... the Gestapo's in on it.  That's a very good sign.  Isn't it a good sign?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Yes, my son, it is a good sign.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: And I have to be very careful of everything I put down on the form. The tiniest detail could make the difference.  Don't you agree?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Isn't it strange?  They are free to go anywhere they want, and they come here to nest.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Watch the birds eat, Helmut... it's so cute...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I'm sure I've got everything here... The important facts from the moment I was arrested, the questions the Gestapo officer asked me...  now what was his name again?  I can't seem to remember what his name was...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: HELMUT...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: What the devil was his name?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Oh, yes, Johann... I'm sorry... you were saying?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: You're not a religious man, are you, Helmut?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Well, I... ah...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Not sure I am myself anymore.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Yet... when I see those birds, I wonder...  were they sent here to let us know this place really isn't God forsaken?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: He should have sent them elsewhere... they could be eaten here!

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: I think we should eat it!

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Not on your life...  Er, that is... I wouldn't...

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: Put it somewhere so it can brighten up the place.

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: It would take a hell of a lot more than that to brighten up this place.

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: It'll be better than looking at your long face.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Do you see the way it's sprouting... I told you it wasn't completely rotten.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: That's nice, Johann.  Do you remember when I filled out those last forms? The date might be important.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: About four weeks ago, I think.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I'll put it up here on the window sill, it'll get the morning sun.

Speaker: stout prisoner
Dialogue: Think you can trust your potato so close to me, Reverend?

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: The potato he TRUSTS... it's you he doesn't trust!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: ATTENTION !

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: All the prisoners from the other side of the camp are being moved over to this side of the camp over to this side of the camp.  Barracks "H" will make room for three additional bunks.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: I want all the bunks moved down toward the far end.  Get them as close together as possible. Now! GET MOVING!

Speaker: the men
Dialogue: Gotta have more room... We need more space...  Hey, watch where you're going. This is stupid!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: YOU!  You down there at the end... get those bunks right up against the wall.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Hurry it up!  Come on, get moving!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Get them close.  You're all going to be nice and cozy in here.

Speaker: stout prisoner
Dialogue: Yeah, like triplets before they are born to a mother weighing 98 pounds...

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: That's what I call cozy!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Excuse me, sir, the papers...  Did they arrive yet?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: They'll have to wait!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: You'd think, since he was coming over here anyway, the least he could do was bring the papers with him.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: This moving men around has undoubtedly kept him very busy... don't worry, he'll bring them.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I'm sure if I asked him again he'd really become annoyed with me.  Would you remind him for me, please?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Of course I will.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I've seen you around the yard, but the others...

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: Do you think they're bringing in war prisoners?

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: I don't know why they're sending them here...  we're overcrowded as it is.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: No, no... it's got to be something else...  Otherwise they would have left the bunks.

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: It could be possible that he is fixing up the barracks for some of his lady friends.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: That many women?

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: Reverend, we Germans are SUPERMEN!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: ATTENTION !

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: We might as well be outside.

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: If I get pneumonia, I'll hold the government responsible!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: With a little luck, you'll both get pneumonia!

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: It's sure quiet in here...

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: Hey, Galt!  Come over and look at this!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: Ain't it cute?

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: It's a God damn posie!

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: Looks kinda sick, doesn't it?

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: It's one of them potato things... and it sure as hell is sick!

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: Maybe we should put it out of its misery.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: No, we don't want to do that...  we might break someone's heart.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Whose little plant is this?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: The plant is MINE!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Is it now?  Tell me precious... do you knit, too?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: If necessary, I can... and I do !

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: What do you think of that, Uhlmann... he knits!

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: Now, if he could just cook...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Can you cook, sweetheart?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: If necessary, I can cook, yes!  Now, if you don't mind, I'll take that plant!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Alright, old man, you really want it?

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Go get it!!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Why don't you pick on someone your own size...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: You heard me!  Give him his plant back, and leave him alone...  He didn't bother you ... and if you have to show your muscle, there's plenty of other guys to pick on!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: You're my size!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: He's alright... that'll teach him to keep his nose out of my business... here's your plant!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Go on, little man, reach for it!

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: Give it to him!

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: You heard him... give it to him!

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: You've had your fun... give it to him... NOW!

Speaker: stout prisoner
Dialogue: RIGHT NOW!!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Sure, here's your stupid flower or whatever you call it...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Thank you...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: What's the matter with you guys? Can't you take a joke?

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: What joke?

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Hell, all I was doing was trying to have a little fun.

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: Have it with someone else!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: What's so special about him?

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: That's the Reverend.  Even when they came and dragged him from his church...  he kept right on preaching against them until they knocked him unconscious.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Well, how the hell was I supposed to know?

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: NOW you know!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: You and your posies...

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: That was close...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Where were you when I need you?

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: I make love, not war!  Hey, that's pretty good... I made that up... Make love, not war!  I bet that would make a good slogan someday...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Aw, shut up!

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: That was really very nice of you, Helmut...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Yeah, nice and STUPID!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Come in!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: What the hell are you doing here? Who gave you permission to leave your quarters?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Are you some kind of privileged character?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Then what are you doing out of the barracks?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: If you'll shut your stupid mouth maybe I can answer one of your questions!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: I have a STUPID MOUTH?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I didn't mean to raise my voice...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: The volume of your voice isn't the issue...  it's what comes out of your mouth that disturbs me...  maybe you need a little lesson in respect and courtesy...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: ... and maybe I've been a little too soft with you...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: You see, Doork, I knew why you came in here...  I knew why you left your barracks without permission... It's just that I hadn't heard you mention your release papers for so long I had hoped I could hear you begging once more...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I'm sorry...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: I'm sorry, I'm sorry... You're a sorry specimen of a human being... that's what you are...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Now, I will help you to your quarters, Herr Doork, here you will stay, and pray for release papers that may, or may not, ever come...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Now, get inside where you belong and don't ever let me catch you doing anything without permission again.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Reverend!  If you don't watch that idiot, we may have to get him a keeper!

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Helmut, Helmut, how could you think of doing such a thing? I begged you not to irritate him...  and that I would ask him about your papers... that wasn't smart, Helmut... not smart at all...  as a matter of fact...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Leave me alone!  ... and mind your own business... Just leave me be...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Reverend, let him sleep... you move out, I'll take care of this...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: You are a sick looking group of things...  I can't even call you human...  because you're not... you're all lice...  DISMISSED!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Doork!  Move it out, and on the double!!

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: It looks like Helmut found some new ears to listen to his Super Star fantasies...

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: Ringling Brothers would have done anything for me to appear with them but I had to do what was best for me!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: So I told Mr. Ringling if he wanted "Helmut" he'd have to bring his circus to Germany... I am a German, I told him, and my responsibility is to my own people who are my biggest fans.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Of course I did... they offered me anything...  anything I wanted to go with them.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Right!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: It doesn't happen overnight... it takes years and years... You try many faces, then finally you hit the one that's just right for you.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Wait, let me tell you some other things...  I mean things that are really exciting and...  please! Please... let me just have a few more...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Did you know "clowns" literally bequeath their faces to their sons, or sometimes to...

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: Hey, Galt, it's your turn, how about doin' one of your belly dances for us?

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Reverend?

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Well, Reverend, what do you think? Would a little belly-dancing be too much for the boys?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: A little fun is what we need... so... if you'll all hold the noise down, I'll join in.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: A clown?  Who's a clown??

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: You've heard of "Helmut Doork". That's him down there!

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: Don't waste your time.  You'll never get the Great Doork to do anything.

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: You're wasting your time.  He doesn't perform for the likes of us... he'll turn you down.

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: He's right, we've been asking him for three years...  I have a feeling he only does his little routines for the crowned heads of Europe.

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: And, of course, the BIG heads of Berlin.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I'd like to, but I can't... really... I can't.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Can't?  Did I hear you say you can't?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: He can tell you... He's seen me work...  I need props... make-up... I work with a lot of different things...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Sure, tell them... I can't just do anything...  I need lights, props, my costume.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Now, me and these... gentlemen... we don't expect you to do your "act", just a little something that'll give us a laugh, that's all.

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: Aw, forget it... and that's probably his problem...  he's forgotten how!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Play a little music, like in a circus...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: There!  Ain't that nice?  Don't it put you in a mood?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I TOLD YOU!  I need things to do my act.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Yeah, that drunk thing...  that does sound funny...

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I still need many things... props and...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Hey... are you trying to fool us?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Leave him alone!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Stay out of this, Reverend. We're not doing anything... We just want him to join in the fun.

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: Right!  If a Reverend can give us a laugh, why not a clown?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: It doesn't have to be anything special... a little dance, maybe?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Like that disgusting exhibition you did?  Oh, no... not me!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Can't you get it through your heads, I need...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: WE need you to give us a laugh.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: So... TRY!

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: That's enough, leave him alone!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Stay out of it, Reverend!

Speaker: the men
Dialogue: Choke him harder...  see if that's funny!  Make him dance! Hey, Doork!... be funny now! He don't look so funny to me!  He sure as hell looks funny to me!  Hey, Galt, pull his string and make the dummy funny!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Your public is calling, clown... now, clown!

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: On your feet!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: He was showing us some of his funny clown falls...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Because of all the noise coming from in here -- I have been called up front to explain...  I don't like to be called up front...  I don't like to have to explain...  Back to your bunks, all of you... Turn out the lights, and keep it QUIET !

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I was just going to ask him about the forms... my release...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: That was not the time, believe me!

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Hurt much?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: No, I'm alright... thank you.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Johann, why do they pick on me? I've never done anything to them.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: You've never done anything for them!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: You think I should have performed?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: The men would have appreciated it.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Johann!

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: What is it?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: They don't believe me, do they?  I mean about being a clown?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Oh, I'd say you've convinced most. However --  There is one you haven't convinced...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: You, Helmut... you!

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: They've put up barbed wire!

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: What the hell... ?

Speaker: stout prisoner
Dialogue: Youngsters!  They've got youngsters over there.

Speaker: young prisoner
Dialogue: Women!

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: Another fence!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: What does it mean?  What do they need a fence for?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Misery loves company.  Looks like they're going to deny us even that.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: All right.  All right, move.  Hurry it up.  Move.

Speaker: loudspeaker
Dialogue: Attention!  The Commandant issues the following special order:  the north side of the camp is now temporary quarters for non-Aryan prisoners.  Fraternizing between Aryan and non-Aryan prisoners is strictly prohibited.  Any violation of this order will be severely punished.  Heil Hitler... Repeating...

Speaker: loudspeaker
Dialogue: The Commandant issues the following special order:

Speaker: loudspeaker
Dialogue: The north side of the camp is now temporary quarters for non-Aryan prisoners.  Fraternizing between Aryan and non-Aryan prisoners is...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Jews!

Speaker: loudspeaker
Dialogue: ... strictly prohibited.  Any violation of this order will be severely punished.  Heil Hitler.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Prisoners from barracks H remain in line.  Barracks H will remain in line.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: I said last night I didn't think I would enjoy being called up to account for the noise coming from barracks H.  I can tell you this morning I didn't enjoy it.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: I don't know what caused the trouble last night, but I'm not blaming you entirely.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: We're going to correct that.  I've been told that energy comes from food.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: So... to help you... all rations are canceled for the next... forty-eight hours.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: And, if that doesn't quiet you down, I'll think of some other ideas you'll like even less. I'm going to make this barracks the quietest in the camp.  Is that clear?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Now, don't blame me.  I didn't start the trouble last night.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Fall out.

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: Bastard!

Speaker: stout prisoner
Dialogue: I can't go without food. I'll starve.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Helmut, don't.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: He's the one we can thank for the diet.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Sir?  Corporal...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Doork.  Helmut Doork.  Remember? The papers... You said... Remember the special forms for the Gestapo to review my case.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: No papers.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: What'd you say now, Mr. Doork, Almighty!  Last night he wouldn't give us a laugh.  Today they won't give us food.

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: What were you doing?  Making a deal with your guard pal to slip you some food?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Because of last night... I'm not getting them.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: When this blows over, Helmut, we'll...

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: Don't feel sorry for him.  He's got no one to blame but himself.  The whole thing was his doing.

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: He's been telling us how great he is; how funny.  Why?  Why couldn't he have done a trick or two for us?

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: The Reverend did a turn.  What's so special about him?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Don't start anything here.  We're in enough trouble.

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: We're not starting anything, we're finishing something.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: We've decided Doork here is going to keep us laughing so hard we won't be able to hear our stomachs growling.

Speaker: stout prisoner
Dialogue: Better hurry it up, clown.  'Cause my stomach's growling already. Can you hear it?

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: Hear it!  The whole place hears it.

Speaker: men
Dialogue: Yeah, Doork, do a trick. How about that night in Munich when they wouldn't stop laughing.  How about it, Doork? Come on, just a little trick.  Give us one laugh.  That's all we're asking for.  Come on, Helmut, do something.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: He's going to do it!  He's going to do it!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Nothing pleases an artist more than to perform.  I'm going to do a real show for you.  All I ask is that you give me a little time...  time to get things together...  things I can use as props...  I'll even try to make a costume, and...

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: You don't need a costume.  We've got imagination.

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: Do the drunk pretzel like the kid suggested last night.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: And do it now, clown.  No more stalling.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Let me through.

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: Aren't we good enough for you?

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: He'd do his tricks fast enough if his guard pal asked him.  Wouldn't you, Doork?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Do something, Karl.  For God's sake, do something.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: And be sure it's funny.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: You make us scream... scream with laughter...  or I'll tear you to shreds on the wire.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: All right... all right.

Speaker: men
Dialogue: If he's Germany's greatest clown, God help the Fatherland.  Doork, the Great!  You got paid for that?  To go without food is bad enough, but to have to watch that!

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: He's no clown.  Not even a bad one.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I am.  I am a clown!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Give me a chance.  I just got started.

Speaker: adolf
Dialogue: You stink.  You really stink.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I... I slipped.   I can do it.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I am a clown.   I am.  I am.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Doork the Great.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Come back, damn you, come back.  The children... they're laughing.  They're laughing.  I am a clown.  I am a clown.

Speaker: big prisoner
Dialogue: It's my stomach that's sensitive.

Speaker: old prisoner
Dialogue: Here comes your second helping.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Here.

Speaker: big prisoner
Dialogue: How're the shoes?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Perfect.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Don't forget the bowl.

Speaker: big prisoner
Dialogue: Hey, Doork!

Speaker: big prisoner
Dialogue: My shoes!

Speaker: big prisoner
Dialogue: I said you could use 'em, not ruin 'em.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I had to fix them this way...  for the act, you know.  Wait till you see how funny it is.

Speaker: big prisoner
Dialogue: Yeah.  But will I feel like laughing when it gets cold!

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Don't worry.

Speaker: big prisoner
Dialogue: Worry!  I'm the one who'll get frost bitten toes, not you.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: When I return them, they'll be like new.  I promise.

Speaker: big prisoner
Dialogue: For what you've done to my shoes I should get more food.

Speaker: old prisoner
Dialogue: He's got to have something to eat.

Speaker: old prisoner
Dialogue: If he gives you his other meal... he'll starve to death.  Then you won't get anything.

Speaker: big prisoner
Dialogue: Remember... you fix them before you bring 'em back.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Promise.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Don't tell us.  Tell him.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: What am I supposed to do? Use pins?

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: Who has a pin?

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: You can laugh.  He isn't always after you for something.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: No?

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: What's that?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Chalk.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: What for?

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: Where'd you get it?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: From a guard.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: A very bad Nazi.  Still has a heart.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: I wish he'd have a heart and use someone else's coat. Or better yet -- his own.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Ask him.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Finally got it.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Isn't that what you wanted?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: This will do more for the act than anything.  Wait'll you see!

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: For a moment there you had me worried.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: I see you got smart.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: His conscience bothered him.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I thought he would kill you when he saw what you had done to his shoes.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: So did I.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: I don't know what I'm laughing at... look at what he's doing to my coat.  Look at it!  Yesterday a button off.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I've got to have it.  It is the only one I can get on and still is tight enough to look funny.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: At the rate you are tearing it up, it's going to look a lot funnier.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Give in, Franz.  You know he's going to talk you out of it again.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I'll be careful.  I swear. Besides, I've got to have it. I explained before...  a clown can't change his costume.  It's his trademark.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: I know... I know... but...

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Why should he give it to a Jew clown? Right, kid?

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: That's got nothing to do with it.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: What's the matter with you bastards anyway?  All he ever did for us was cause trouble, but for them...  I say he's one of them.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: If he were, he'd be over there

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: That's where he belongs.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: What're you so hot about?  It's no skin off your...

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: We've got a good reason for not liking them.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: If it wasn't for them... we wouldn't be in here.

Speaker: herman
Dialogue: What'd you mean?

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: A bunch of them got picked up with papers we'd sold them.   And what'd they do?  Turn us in, they did.  The ungrateful...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: So that was it!  Counterfeit papers. I can imagine the prices.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Supply and demand, Reverend.  Supply and demand.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: Take it, Doork -- anytime you want it.

Speaker: uhlmann
Dialogue: What's so terrible about what we did?  Lot of them got out of the country with our papers.  They were damn good counterfeits.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: And what's more, we never charged for children.  Never.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I've been meaning to ask you.  Heard anymore about the request for a review of your case?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Did you hear the laughs I got yesterday?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Not just from the children... but the adults, too.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Never thought of that.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: They said I couldn't come up with anything new.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: At the circus.  Schmidt and the rest. Wait'll they see my act now.  It's funny.  Really funny.  Isn't it?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: The children certainly enjoy it.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: What I needed was time.  Time to concentrate on new material.  A man's got to have time alone.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: You call this being alone?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Do you think... maybe... they'd let me go to other camps and entertain?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I'd have to get to the Commandant. Would need his permission.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: If you have time later, I'd like you to see something I've been working on.  I hunch down and do a tiny soldier parading.  Think they'll like it?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Who?  The adults?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: The children, of course.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I thought the smart clown only played to the adults.

Speaker: aide
Dialogue: He's coming back down the hall.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Heil Hitler.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Come in.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Oh, stand at ease.  And, close the door.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: I don't have to tell you why your Commandant was relieved of his command here. This prison is a disgrace. Disgrace! The latitude allowed by him will not be tolerated by me. Understand?

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: That includes the staff.  I'm going to turn this place into a model prison, a credit to the Reich. Understand?

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Speak up.

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Yes, Colonel.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: This isn't the first prison the SS has had to take over from the military. Military men are too soft to deal with those...  Scharff starts to speak but quickly changes his mind.

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: You were about to say something?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Oh... I... was just going to say that I didn't hold with the soft treatment of the prisoners.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Good!  Our first order of business is to prepare...

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Our first order of business is to prepare all non-Aryan prisoners for shipment in two weeks.

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Where are they being sent, Colonel?

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Work camps.

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: But we have about 40 children, some only babies, with more scheduled to arrive tomorrow or the next day. They're not going to be much use in a work camp.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: I'm aware of that.  This order covers only the adult prisoners over fifteen. We won't have to wet nurse the children for long.  Other plans are being made for...

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: What is that?

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: What is that supposed to be?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: That!  Well, you see, sir, one of the prisoners used to be a circus clown.  Sometimes he gives a little... well...  a sort of show -- for the children.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Am I correct in assuming that those children are on the non-Aryan side of the camp?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: And the... buffoon?  A German?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Yes, Colonel.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Am I to believe you aren't aware of the general order absolutely forbidding fraternization?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: I know about it, sir.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Close the window.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Just what do you think fraternization means, Lieutenant Scharff ?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Communication.   Social contact. Giving aid, talking...

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: How long has this been going on?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Just the last two or three weeks.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: And the Commandant approved?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Well, sir, children are very hard to handle.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: This clown!  Who is he?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: It's... I know.  It's Doork, the Great.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Not his clown name, you idiot.  His number.  His identification.

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: If I have the Colonel's permission to leave, I will check it at once.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Later.  Right now I want these performances halted.  Understand?

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Yes, sir.

Speaker: bestler
Dialogue: Immediately!

Speaker: scharff
Dialogue: Yes, sir !

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: That's all.  Show's over.  Everybody clear out.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: You heard me.  Show's over.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Go on.  Get away.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Move, damn it, before I come over there and...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Get them moving before somebody gets hurt.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: That's all the show for today.  Go back inside.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: That's right now, go along.  I'll see you tomorrow.  Goodbye.  Goodbye. Until tomorrow.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Get inside and take that stuff off your face.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I don't understand.  What's the matter?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Orders.  No more shows.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: You mean... not ever?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: That's right.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: But we weren't doing any harm.

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: The Commandant thinks you are.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: The Commandant?

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: The new Commandant.  He minds.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Just because I make them laugh a little...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: You know the rule... no mixing with Jews.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I wasn't mixing!  I was only...

Speaker: guard
Dialogue: Now do what I tell you and save yourself a lot of grief.

Speaker: franz
Dialogue: What happened?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: He says I've got to stop -- with the children.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I've been expecting it.

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: Because they're Jews?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Because of the laughing.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Why should that bother them?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: When you rule by fear, laughter is the most frightening sound in the world.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I can't go out there.  I can't take another day of them staring at me.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: They'll get over it.  Disappointment is no stranger to those children.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: They look at me as though it was all my fault.  Haven't they been told why I can't...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I'm sure they have.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Then why do they stare?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: It's amazing how a thing like this can feed off itself.  Think how lucky we would be if we could do that.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I sewed a button on.  Look all right?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Fine.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I did make them laugh.  Didn't I?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I wish they'd get them out of here. Prison is no place for little children.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: We've been all over that before. You've got to stop thinking about them.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: You're right!  I've got to think of myself.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: It's too hot in here.  I'm going to get some air.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Johann... do you think there's any possible way I could talk to the Commandant.  Maybe I could make him understand...

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: There's nothing you can do... but forget.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: How can I!  They were my own very special audience.  And now they stare at me as if I had betrayed them.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: They're children, Helmut.  You can't expect them to understand the madness of adults.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: If I could talk to them.  To the children themselves -- that would help, wouldn't it?

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: If I explain it to them -- then they'll know I am not mad at them.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: You go near that fence once again... and you're taking your life in your own hands.  You know that as well as I do.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I would just need a minute.  A minute to talk to them.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I wish to God I didn't care.  I wish to God I could forget them.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: But I can't.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I'm going to ask you a question, Helmut, and I want you to think carefully before you answer.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: The reason you can't get them out of your mind -- is it because you need them -- for you audience?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: I want the truth.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: I really don't know what the reason is.  I think it's got something to do with... well, I don't want those little ones to think I've turned against them, too.  That's why I've got to do something.  Something.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: You'll be taking a chance.  A great chance.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: All right!  Come on then.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: You want to talk to the children? Well, I think I can help you.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: There's no reason for you to get involved in this.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Reason?  When war is waged against children!  That is reason enough for the whole damn world to get involved. And it will, believe me, it will.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: So, come on, Doork the Great, let's start getting involved.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Wait here.

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: Kessler is going to talk to the children. Cover him.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: Who says so?

Speaker: ludwig
Dialogue: The Reverend says cover him... so we cover him.

Speaker: galt
Dialogue: All right!  I was just asking.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: You know what to do?

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Stay behind the men and keep an eye out for the guards on the other side.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Right.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: Make it quick.  You won't have much time.

Speaker: keltner
Dialogue: And Helmut, keep the children quiet. We don't want trouble.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Kick it, Ludwig.  Kick it!

Speaker: children
Dialogue: Doork, Doork, Doork is back.  It's Doork.  It's Doork.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Shhh.  Shhhh.  The guards...

Speaker: children
Dialogue: Do a trick, Doork.  Please, Doork, please, please.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: No, no.  I can't.  The guards won't let me.  Not now.  Maybe some other day.

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: They're bad.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: What is it?  What happened?

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: He hurt himself.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Shhh.  Shhh.  Don't cry.  It's going to be all right.  Be careful when you're near this fence.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Here, wrap this around it.  I'll make it all better.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: Hush now.  Stop crying.  Please. Look... Look at this.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: There, that's better.  No more crying now.

Speaker: helmut
Dialogue: What's the matter with them?

Speaker: little girl
Dialogue: They're new.  We can't understand them.  All they do is cry.

Speaker: older boy
Dialogue: They're all the way from Czechoslovakia.

Speaker: helmut
